newsitem.title: USA: Air traffic tower unveiled at Washington airport.
newsitem.headline: Air traffic tower unveiled at Washington airport.

text.p: A new air traffic control tower was unveiled at Washington National airport on Tuesday, replacing one installed when the airport opened 56 years ago.

The Federal Aviation Administration said the new 201-foot tower, with automated windshear detector and ground collision avoidance systems, will be operational on April 5. The original 78-foot tower has been in use since 1941.
The new tower is part of a $1 billion modernisation programme at the airport, to be completed in July.
More than seven million passengers used National last year, the FAA said. That number is expected to rise to nearly 10 million by 2010.
